intro: Cylicodaphne obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leafed sago palm, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its tall, unbranched trunk and large, fan-shaped leaves that are deeply divided. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue berries. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental foliage in gardens. Cylicodaphne obtusata is relatively slow-growing and requires well-drained soil and full sun to thrive.
